intro: Rosa villosa f. adenoclada, commonly known as the hairy rose or velvet rose, is a compact shrub characterized by its dense, thornless stems and profuse flowering habit. It features fragrant, semi-double pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has ovate to elliptical leaves with soft, downy undersides, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It is native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe, where it thrives in well-drained soils. This cultivar is prized for its ornamental value and is often used in garden landscapes for its beauty and hardiness.
